com.eatthepath.jvptree.util

Class MedianDistanceThresholdSelectionStrategy<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eatthepath.jvptree.util.MedianDistanceThresholdSelectionStrategy<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ThresholdSelectionStrategy<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SamplingMedianDistanceThresholdSelectionStrategy

    public class MedianDistanceThresholdSelectionStrategy<T>
extends Object
implements ThresholdSelectionStrategy<T>
    A threshold distance selection strategy that uses the median distance from the origin as the threshold.
    Author:
    Jon Chambers

    • Method Detail

      • selectThreshold

        public <R extends T> double selectThreshold(List<R> points,
                                   R origin,
                                   DistanceFunction<? super R> distanceFunction)
        Returns the median distance of the given points from the given origin. This method will partially sort the list of points in the process.
        Specified by:
        selectThreshold in interface ThresholdSelectionStrategy<T>
        Parameters:
        points - the list of points from which a median distance will be chosen
        origin - the point from which distances to other points will be calculated
        distanceFunction - the function to be used to calculate the distance between the origin and other points
        Returns:
        the median distance from the origin to the given list of points
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given list of points is empty
